answer:
In BC, the hepatitis A vaccine is publicly funded (free) for Indigenous people 6 months to 18 years of age and others. Read about who is eligible for the hepatitis A vaccine here. ImmunizeBC does not provide travel vaccine or reimbursement advice. Please contact your health insurance provider for information about reimbursement for travel vaccines. 
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## In BC, the hepatitis A vaccine is publicly funded (free) for Indigenous people 6 months to 18 years of age and others.

Read about who is eligible for the hepatitis A vaccine here.
ImmunizeBC does not provide travel vaccine or reimbursement advice.
Please contact your health insurance provider for information about reimbursement for travel vaccines.
Immunization Nurse
question: I paid for some vaccines that I thought would be covered because of my indigenous status. I paid for Hepatitis A and Typhoid, as well as the appointment fee, but had other friends that did not have to pay. The vaccines were not available on Haida Gwaii so I had to travel to Vancouver to receive.
question_variation_0: are vaccines provided on Haida Gwaii
question_variation_1: vaccines that are not available on haida gwaii
question_variation_2: did the appointment fee cover vaccination fees
